case_study.institution: IMD - International Institute for Management Development
case_study.description: This case examines the challenges faced by KasKazi Network, a successful distribution company serving bottom-of-the-pyramid markets in Kenya. The company struggles with the seasonal nature of manufacturer contracts, which creates demand fulfillment gaps and opportunities for counterfeit products. The case explores the strategic decision to develop own-brand products to achieve year-round operations and better serve customers.
case_study.primary_challenge: Seasonal contract dependency and market continuity

learning_outcomes.description: Students will analyze the challenges of dependency on short-term client contracts and evaluate alternative business models for sustainable growth.

learning_outcomes.outcome: Bottom of the Pyramid Market Understanding
learning_outcomes.description: Students will gain insights into the unique characteristics, opportunities, and challenges of serving low-income consumer markets in emerging economies.
Students will examine distribution strategies for reaching underserved markets and the role of local knowledge in competitive advantage.
Students will evaluate the strategic decision to develop own-brand products as a solution to market continuity challenges.
Students will understand the challenges of counterfeit products in emerging markets and strategies for market protection.
Students will assess various business risks including supply chain risks, market risks, and operational risks in developing economies.

phases.title: Market Analysis and Problem Identification
phases.goal: Complete a comprehensive stakeholder analysis and value chain mapping to identify key business challenges.
activities: Teams analyze the current business model of KasKazi Network
Identify key stakeholders and their interests
Assess the impact of seasonal contracts on business sustainability

phases.title: Strategic Challenge Deep Dive
phases.goal: Analyze root causes of seasonal contract issues and assess competitive landscape.
activities: Analyze the root causes of the seasonal contract challenge
Evaluate the impact on end customers and market development
Assess the counterfeit product threat and market implications
Examine competitive advantages and market positioning

phases.title: Strategic Options Development
phases.goal: Develop strategic options and evaluate own-brand product opportunities.
activities: Assess market entry options for sanitary towels
Analyze risks and opportunities of each strategic option
deliverables: Preliminary business case for own-brand strategy

phases.title: Implementation Planning and Presentation
phases.goal: Create implementation roadmap with financial projections and risk mitigation.
activities: Develop implementation roadmap for chosen strategy
Create financial projections and resource requirements

key_decision_points.decision: Prioritize which business challenges to address first
Choose between maintaining status quo or pursuing new strategy
Select specific own-brand products and market entry strategy
Finalize implementation timeline and resource allocation

teaching_notes.preparation_required: Students should read the case thoroughly and research bottom-of-the-pyramid market concepts
discussion_questions: What are the key challenges facing KasKazi Network's current business model?
How does the seasonal nature of contracts affect different stakeholders?
What are the strategic implications of developing own-brand products?
How should KasKazi Network address the counterfeit product challenge?
What are the key success factors for serving bottom-of-the-pyramid markets?
